website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you need an affordable harness for basic use, but check out others that offer more reliable protection for bigger climbs.
pros: Has leg straps and double-back buckles for excellent weight distribution
Easy to adjust and has durable stitching
A good pick for minor climbs, beginners, and indoor rock climbing
cons: Fit is somewhat uncomfortable for larger individuals
We wish it had more padding

customer_reviews.title: Inccorect item
customer_reviews.text: The item I received is not the item I paid for. In the original item description it shows adjustable leg to back pad webbing. In my picture you can clearly see it is a fixed length. The thing sits too low and I cant pull the waist pad up high enough because the leg pads are too close to my crotch. RETURNING
customer_reviews.author: Recon7

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and poorly designed for price point
customer_reviews.text: Can find a much better quality harness for close to the same price
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Jipped
customer_reviews.text: The item was too big. I returned the item but was NOT given a full refund. I'm very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Karma West

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This harness over all is pretty good. Has a good lower back support so it doesn’t cut into you like some do, seems well made with god stitching and stays tight as you’re working
customer_reviews.author: Brett Milliner

customer_reviews.title: Sucks not as described
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure that it said I can't wait to free carabiner and a sender but it didn't come with either
customer_reviews.author: Luis Rivera

customer_reviews.title: It'll get the job done safely.
customer_reviews.text: Great safety harness for the money. Would like to see easier adjustment for straps once it's on, but it's cheap. Quality is there in comfort and build quality. It's a good, safe harness. Just a little unrefined.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Received product 5 days late because it was delivered to wrong address. Very pleased with product. Using it as safety harness to work on roof of house
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is not a high end arborist harness but it is comfortable and works well. I need a little more back support than my minimalist harness was providing and this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tim (crash)

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great construction. Worked well for my fat butt. Used once so far, and VERY happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fairies Myst

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I used it the first time next to a sea cliff, I recomend it!
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, well designed
customer_reviews.text: Good quality , well designed. Using for working on home antenna tower with load bearing carabiners.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The product works and does what it was intended to do. However, it's extremely uncomfortable. Might be that I weight 200lbs but I will be returning, I cant possibly use this product, maybe 10 years ago when I was 150lb.
customer_reviews.author: patricio

customer_reviews.title: Good for indoor rock climbing
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for indoor rock climbing and love them. We double and triple checked to ensure they were safe, and even asked the people at the front desk, who couldn't find any concerns with them. That being said, we used these in a safe, indoor area with padding underneath us, and we're both relatively in good shape. As far as using them outside, differing body types, etc. I can't speak to its usefulness, but for indoor rock climbing it's great.
customer_reviews.author: J &K Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Like many reviewers I have no intention of every climbing ...
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers I have no intention of every climbing any rocks...I bought this to do some repairs on a very steep roof. Worked great. With any luck, I will never have to use it again ;^)
customer_reviews.author: UPW812

customer_reviews.title: Good, comfortable harness
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable harness. Adjustments are quick and secure. For the price, I was not expecting too much and was pleasantly surprised at the quality. I tested the harness at low heights and did not experience any loosening, tightening, or stretching issues. Good harness.
customer_reviews.author: Clayguy

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: It works for its purpose, to keep you safe. You get what you pay for. I can't hate on it for the price when it does serve its purpose. Pros- its cheap and keeps you from falling Cons- it is not comfortable for more then a few minutes climbing, don't expect to clip on a bunch of tools and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and fulfilled its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this harness to go outdoor rock climbing and it worked perfectly well when worn by both guys and girls as well as with the climbing ropes we used. It was easy to put on and adjust too.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Henley

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for safety use on roof work. Excellent fit on 18 y old 5'8 130 lb build. He felt completely secure and was able to move around the steep metal roof with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I used it for a recent project as a safety harness. It was fully adjustable (you can adjust it around your thighs and waist). It is pretty small and light weight too. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: TomaPeti

customer_reviews.title: Right Leg strap threads pulled out
customer_reviews.text: Safety harness was working great until the stitching broke, luckily my kid was not injured. These will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Pcollier

customer_reviews.title: harness suited pretty comfortably and can be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: This product is real life saver . I used it on tree branches cutting . This harness makes job very safe and secure , harness suited pretty comfortably and can be adjusted . Highly recommended for sports and works.
customer_reviews.author: Kamil Yafizov

customer_reviews.title: Good for undemanding
customer_reviews.text: Good for undemanding, occasional use. Ruggedly made and secure. You wouldn't want to hang all day in it, but if you need to do a little arborist work or such it is a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JayT

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, good price but..... while it will save your life, it might leave you hanging upside down!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Bettencourt

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is not a one-size-fits-all as described. I’m 6’ 170 lbs. and it is enormous, dangerously so. Had to return it. For something that is meant to keep you safe when climbing, even if you are just climbing a tree to do some trimming, you really should invest in something better. Ended up buying the Black Diamond Momentum harness for $57; it is a vast improvement in quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The belt is strong enough for a light person, under 180lbs, however, I would not feel secure with someone heavier. The straps loosen by themselves during use, and that is a problem when its function relies on the harness remaining snug, especially at the waist, the tighter the better. There is no carabiner or heavy D-ring, only a couple small ones that I would not trust to carry much if any load, and in a fall, the slack recovery strains the belt exponentially. I don't suggest using this harness without a substantial anchor. For a climbing wall on belay, or short rappels its works, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Overwatch

customer_reviews.title: Not allowed in climbing gyms
customer_reviews.text: This harness works great, but my climbing gym would not allow it. They said you need two loops for a caribeaner to go through, not just the single loop. Might be nice for more casual use, but know that if you are using for a climbing gym they may not allow it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hartman

customer_reviews.title: better then you think
customer_reviews.text: Here are the differences from this cheap one to the expensive ones. This one: "s" pattern stiching, no padding, one place to hang caribeaners " hope this is how you spell that" Expensive ones: padding every where, multiple places for caribeaners, x pattern stiching. All in all: im a 6'2" 240 lb guy and this cought me every time with no problems at all! It's pretty comfy espishally for no padding! There is plenty of room for caribeaners for indoor climbing. Would I recommend this for beginners, yes absolutely. It's cheap and does it's job well! For advanced climbers? Yes for a spare or friends. For your sole harness no, all day climbing would get painfull.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Roybal

customer_reviews.title: Great harness at a price without the bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: Good harness that is not expensive. Only downside is just one loop for clipping things in. So if you wanted a loop on your left side your out of luck. Most high end climbing harnesses will have four. If you can get past that this is a great harness for folks
customer_reviews.author: Mr Vegas

customer_reviews.title: used this for my sailboat
customer_reviews.text: I used a this to scale my sailboat mast. It worked very well and I felt secure and safe. Actually not too bad on the comfort side either!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie60175

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable rig for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this seat for untrained climbers as it takes some adjustment to fit comfortably and has a lot of access material to contend with after fitting. It is sturdy and should hold up to repeated use without too much fraying. Should work as well as tying your own Swiss seat. My only complaint would be that the front attachment loop is a bit over-sized. Overall a good basic back up rig for trained users.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Amon

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is more for someone medium size taller than 57 on the west side and someone perhaps with a 33 and above size belt for beginners is great after while sitting on a tree or sitting on a rope dangling from the tree it can become very uncomfortable around the legs but again for beginners it is a phenomenal belt the cost you cannot beat it and if you need to have one for an emergency it is a must have
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Colon

customer_reviews.title: Works just as it should, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and use it to rope onto a tree, that supports me while working on a metal roof at various angles..happy!
customer_reviews.author: airgunshooter

customer_reviews.title: Climbing/rappelling harness
customer_reviews.text: Use this Harness only for reppelling down a 45 degree hill to do work and access a remote area. Have used a couple of dozen times and it has worked well. I did have to buy a shoulder harness to hold it up basically making it a full body harness. Recommend the mfg offer their own shoulder harness and simplify the waist tightening and leg tightening system/straps. Overall though works well and a good value
customer_reviews.author: lang

customer_reviews.title: Good for safety purposes.  I wouldn't want to use ot for rappelling or climbing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine harness for occasional safety use for fall protection. For actual climbing or rappelling, it's really uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Not allowed to be used in gym
customer_reviews.text: it is not allowed to used in indoor rock climbing. It is not certified.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Light, good fit, inexpensive and good all around
customer_reviews.text: Needed to climb some 50’ trees for pruning and have experience climbing from the military. This harness is inexpensive And perfect for a “now and then” climber. If I was climbing every weekend I might get wider straps and paddling but this is exactly what I need. Gonna keep it in my jump bag (EMS/rescue) for a quick harness option. I’d buy another one of these in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: GranburyAR

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Bought it for my 5 yr old son for tree climbing and indoor Rock climbing so I can top rope him in both his waist is about 20 inches. I would compare it to the Yates climbing harness. The webbing is thick and durable. The buckles work well have not noticed any slipping or loosening. I have not personally tried it on because I already have a harness. I would definitely use it if needed in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work - too big
customer_reviews.text: We bought for our grandson and we were never able to use it because it was too big for him. While ordered back in December 2019, it is still new in the package after we tried to adjust it and make it work. Is there anyway to return this product? Respectfully submitted,
customer_reviews.author: UNHAPPY WALSONTOP SELLER

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: At the gym, I don't even bother taking off this harness when I go from top-roping to bouldering. It's so comfortable that I forget I'm wearing it. Plus, it's super sturdy, so I'm not worried about it ever ripping or wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I weigh around 230#’s with a 36” waist I use this on a Zip Line it’s comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: 8 SEC.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for my climbing gym (but maybe acceptable for other gyms)
customer_reviews.text: My indoor climbing gym wouldn't let me use this harness. They want something like a diamond hardness instead. Ask your gym before you buy. I saw another person say it worked for their indoor gym so i guess it depends on the gym.
customer_reviews.author: bghouse

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me because it doesn't have side loops
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, but for my use of climbing trees with a tree harness I can't use it. I need loops on each side of my waist and this doesn't have that. I think it would be perfect if you only need the front belly button loop. But for me not work. I would give it a 5 star if it had loops for each side of my waist.
customer_reviews.author: John Clarke Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Climbing harness
customer_reviews.text: Doing some work on my roof and needed to work safe; besides this climbing harness also purchased climbing carabiner hooks, climbing anchor bolt hanger to attach my safety line, and safety harness to and a rigging rope and clips. Now my wife doesn't have to worry while I'm up on the roof; be smart; work safe
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: no comfort
customer_reviews.text: Might save your life but I am not wearing. Bought 4 of these and wish i could send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Sims

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I are new to climbing, but have joined the club and are very excited to continue the journey. We read great reviews on this harness and have been very very happy with the comfort. Would recommend to other newbies.
customer_reviews.author: Bob or Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Good harness
customer_reviews.text: Great climbing harness. I bought this for my wife. We adjusted the straps to fit her once, she just climbs in and out of it with ease. Light weight, durable, simple design.
customer_reviews.author: A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: I would think not for serious rock climbing but then I have never experienced rock climbing. Strong and light weight but to me it needs a shoulder harness as I would not wish to find myself upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Bill V

customer_reviews.title: Good for short static use.
customer_reviews.text: Supported my entire 220lb weight while trimming a tree. Definitely not comfortable and cut off circulation to my legs pretty fast which is very bad news. So sturdy but unbearable for extended load bearing. Also would not want to take a dynamic fall in this.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: Feels well made. Only issue is if you are over a 40” waist you will not get this on over your cloths.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great value
customer_reviews.text: We used 6 of this for an event with hundreds of children. It was easy and convenient to put on and off. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Idriss

customer_reviews.title: Well made, yet light and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good harness and I would recommend it to any one who needs to ascend, descend, I’d stay in one place on a sloped surface. It is slightly uncomfortable because of the waist band buckle can dig in if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent stitches, might be a fake.
customer_reviews.text: Very sloppy stitching. Instead of plenty of stitches like the photo you get some crossed over inconsistent zig zags which look much less safe than the photo. The left and right side aren't even stitched the same.. This is for saving my life, dont cheap out on thread please.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner groups
customer_reviews.text: I took a group of youth to do some rappelling (about 70ft cliff). Most had never done it before. Rather than make them suffer with tie-it-yourself webbing harnesses, I bought a couple of these. Worked great for our purposes. Easy to adjust for varying body sizes (we had skinny 12 year olds to “big-boned” adults). Probably not the most comfortable if you’re going to be in tve harness for several hours, but for a short 2 minute rappell, they got the job done at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: BankofMouse

customer_reviews.title: Basic, and that's great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a harness for not falling off my roof whilst cleaning leaves and this fit the bill perfect. No padding, just straps and simple steel adjustment hardware. I'm 250lb and the leg loops fit me just fine.
customer_reviews.author: COLBY DEAN

customer_reviews.title: Very well build harness. Triple stitch
customer_reviews.text: I need to get up to my roof. So this is a peace of mind for me. I never want to find out I going needing it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Tso

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We only bought it to hook into safety harness while working on a steep 3 story roof and it did what it was supposed to do. It's not as comfortable as a good rock climbing harness but we didn't expect it to be.
customer_reviews.author: hikermom

customer_reviews.title: Well made but not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: So yes it’s cheap but built well. The only down side I had was if you have to let it hold your weight for any period of time it gets super uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Just Right!
customer_reviews.text: I like it and plan on using it while cleaning my roof and in my tree stand. I will use it with the static line and rescue figure 8 that I purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ross1

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Well made and very affordable. Great for the gym. You may need something more for the field. I trust my life with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and put on. It has a hook to attach items that was a nice bonus. My husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly E.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have some problems with the waist gaping and not staying tight when climbing, but it doesn't move too much and seems to improve with each use. As a women with big thighs, the inner straps can ride up uncomfortably over the natural curves in your hips. However, for the price and only a couple of hours of indoor climbing a week, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Madison Rice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product! Great price. Use for work and play. Better than expected. Very nice attention to stitching. Very happy! Fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Watson

customer_reviews.title: Never Climb Without 1
customer_reviews.text: I Highly Recommend Getting 1 Of These If You Are Going To Be Climbing.. Well Made - Light Weight - Durable
customer_reviews.author: D49

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great, used it several times on a few different size people during a day long climbing session. Easy to get on and off. They said they all felt very secure in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Us teletubbies can rejoice, we can now rappel like the mere mortals do. You hunk-o-burnin love you !
customer_reviews.text: Good basic harness. No frills. I have a 42 inch Waist and weigh in at 260lbs. Feels secure. Well made
customer_reviews.author: david m.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I use this to trim trees, not professional quality but seems good, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Aden B

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal.
customer_reviews.text: No instructions were in package but the product itself is fine. Confort and value for money are great. The 3 stars is for missing instructions provided. All safety items must have instructions not matter how simple they look.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: good to have in kit
customer_reviews.text: Bare bones basic harness Still plan to use in conjunction with rigger belt for non complex simple rappelling
customer_reviews.author: DL B

customer_reviews.title: Not like the picture
customer_reviews.text: When you look at the picture that front red piece is not metal it's a strap
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice discount harness.
customer_reviews.text: Nice discount harness, used it on scaffold for safety line connection. Comfortable when wearing and supporting my weight.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My first climbing harness, still getting used to and deciding if I will continue with this as a safety device. More comfortable and less cumbersome than full body harnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Secure, strong and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to climb the mast on my Sailboat. Sturdy well made and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold V

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a great harness
customer_reviews.text: We've been using it for a while now, and this harness seems well made and is exactly what I would expect it to be.
customer_reviews.author: A NINJA Drew

customer_reviews.title: Safe and well priced.
customer_reviews.text: Safe and inexpensive. Can’t beat the price for the feeling of security this harness has to offer. Admittedly, I was extremely skeptical for the price, however, I bought 3 of these (2 were for my 8 and 11 year old) and have not been disappointed yet.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sulfon

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to secure to the outside sliding rail on a yacht. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: fast27

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Harness
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a solid harness. Use at our local climbing gym all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hannin Voorhis

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I’ve used it once and keep it in our “outdoor” bag. Stitching is excellent so I have no doubts about it’s strength capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey day

customer_reviews.title: Great starter harness
customer_reviews.text: Great for the kid nice thick material sturdy and little heavy but to be expected for saefty!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Hangin Out!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend who wanted a heavier duty unit... and still scored a great price! Love It!
customer_reviews.author: Imike

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a zipline set up. They seem perfect for my application. Used with 100 lb children up to 225 lb adults.
customer_reviews.author: M. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a simple harness for my grand-daughter
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I was looking for. only issue I can not legibly read the date on the label
customer_reviews.author: JAW

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used it yet but it appears to be a well made product.
customer_reviews.text: I will be using this to go up on a roof.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: Great buy, not the most comfortable but for that price great value!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia R. A.

customer_reviews.title: And I Fell in Love
customer_reviews.text: Yeah you really have to go all or nothing with the Weanus. It's like a trust fall. You'll know if it works when you dont fall from the climbing wall. That's how I knew. And I fell in love.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great harness! Second time rappelling came off 75ft bluff. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Inspires confidence
customer_reviews.text: Very well priced. I feel much safer with this, doing my tree trimmings...
customer_reviews.author: A. Paez

customer_reviews.title: Half Dome
customer_reviews.text: was not needed but i was happy to know i was safe
customer_reviews.author: car

customer_reviews.title: seems to be sturdy
customer_reviews.text: decent quality of material used to make the product, and adjustable waist and thigh size. just wish it to be higher in the waist area.
customer_reviews.author: cc-milpitas

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Harness is good. Felt safe while trimming my trees. I always want to be safe and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressed - low budget, high quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm an insurance adjuster and needed to replace my old one. This one did the trick. Overall a great product. I leave mine on all day long when I'm running wind and hail claims.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: Great harness! Easy to adjust and use. As comfortable as any other harness. Just ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Knerr

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert, but needed a harness for a rappel and it did the job. DId not had any problems with hit, used it a few times, it showed no sign of wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Partica

customer_reviews.title: Bought on a whim
customer_reviews.text: Yep, bought this on a whim. No idea if I'll ever use it. Seems good though. Lol
customer_reviews.author: VGamble13

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely could be more comfortable. I think my next harness will have more padding on the leg straps.
customer_reviews.author: Otoki

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Richardson

customer_reviews.title: good enough to save your life
customer_reviews.text: We use it at the local climbing gym and they approve it. It cuts into your legs a bit if you hang for a long time. But for climbing and general safety it is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Henckel

customer_reviews.title: good fit for 150lb. person
customer_reviews.text: exactly what I wanted for doing some work where i want to be secure.
customer_reviews.author: suz

customer_reviews.title: Love it, bought two for the kids to climb ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, bought two for the kids to climb trees. So far has worked with big and little kids. They love it, clip in and go. Reasonable priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer T. Gode

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy just not super comfy for climbing and rappelling.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go rappelling, it does the job, but not very comfortable. I went and bought a actual climbing harnesses that is way better. How ever it does work very well as a back up, and for friends that just want to go with me to try rappelling.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit snug, but perfect for indoor rock climbing
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ritchie

product_meta.title: Weanas Thicken Climbing Harness, Protect Waist Safety Harness, Wider Half Body Harness for Mountaineering Fire Rescuing Rock Climbing Rappelling Tree Climbing
feature_bullets: SAFETY FIRST - CE Certified , Half body climbing harness you can trust. Harness Weight limited:300KG, breaking strength 25KN.
WIDER HARNESS - Thicken frame construction guarantees excellent weight distribution for optimal comfort: waistbelt and leg loops with doubled straps. waistbelt wider on the back and legs.

COMFORTABLE - Traditional buckle, harness construction distributes pressure to keep you comfortable while climbing. Waist belts and leg loops are lined with breathable mesh to ensure comfort in warm temperatures.

THOUGHTFUL DEATAILS - Two DoubleBack buckles allow waist belt to be adjusted and secured in a single movement. Perfecting for mountaineering and rock climbing outward band fire rescue working on the higher level caving.
